channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Crude prices are low. Will U.S. companies want Venezuela's oil?
item.description: Most analysts think the world currently makes more oil than it needs — and the kind of oil abundant in Venezuela is a particularly hard-to-refine type of crude. So would U.S. companies even want it?
item.content:encoded: Most analysts think the world currently makes more oil than it needs — and the kind of oil abundant in Venezuela is a particularly hard-to-refine type of crude. So would U.S. companies even want it?
item.dc:creator: Camila Domonoske

item.title: From the border with Colombia: The view of the uncertainty in Venezuela
item.description: Venezuela's interim president sounded compliant after President Trump threatened her with a fate worse than that of overthrown and arrested Nicolás Maduro.
item.content:encoded: Venezuela's interim president sounded compliant after President Trump threatened her with a fate worse than that of overthrown and arrested Nicolás Maduro.
item.dc:creator: Eyder Peralta

item.title: Here's how to view NPR's coverage of Jan. 6, including a timeline, documents and video
item.description: NPR's Jan. 6 coverage includes a database of all the charges filed against more than 1500 defendants. It's now one of the only places that information is publicly accessible.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Jan. 6 coverage includes a database of all the charges filed against more than 1500 defendants. It's now one of the only places that information is publicly accessible.
item.dc:creator: Henry Larson

item.title: President Trump's comments about Greenland dominate European meeting on Ukraine
item.description: A coalition of 35 countries met to discuss Ukraine's sovereignty if and when a peace agreement with Russia is reached. The meeting was overshadowed by worries about the U.S.'s interest in Greenland.
item.content:encoded: A coalition of 35 countries met to discuss Ukraine's sovereignty if and when a peace agreement with Russia is reached. The meeting was overshadowed by worries about the U.S.'s interest in Greenland.
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: Pentagon, under Hegseth, to review role of women in ground combat units
item.description: The Pentagon is mounting a six-month review of women in ground combat positions, according to a memo obtained by NPR.
item.content:encoded: The Pentagon is mounting a six-month review of women in ground combat positions, according to a memo obtained by NPR.
item.dc:creator: Tom Bowman

item.title: Trial of former Uvalde school officer where 21 people died opens in Texas
item.description: A former Uvalde, Texas, police officer goes to trial for his response in the 2022 school shooting that left 19 students and two teachers dead. He faces 29 charges of child endangerment.
item.content:encoded: A former Uvalde, Texas, police officer goes to trial for his response in the 2022 school shooting that left 19 students and two teachers dead. He faces 29 charges of child endangerment.
item.dc:creator: Camille Phillips

item.title: For this artist, the New York City MetroCard offered infinite possibilities
item.description: For artist Thomas McKean, the New York City MetroCard was anything but mundane. He used cut-up bits of the cards to create hundreds of sculptures and collages, and still has a stockpile to work with.
item.content:encoded: For artist Thomas McKean, the New York City MetroCard was anything but mundane. He used cut-up bits of the cards to create hundreds of sculptures and collages, and still has a stockpile to work with.
item.dc:creator: Ava Berger

item.title: The Corporation for Public Broadcasting votes to end operations
item.description: The Corporation for Public Broadcasting has voted to formally end operations. NPR's mission will continue, unchanged.
item.content:encoded: The Corporation for Public Broadcasting has voted to formally end operations. NPR's mission will continue, unchanged.
item.dc:creator: Marc Rivers

item.title: Who's running Venezuela?
item.description: President Trump says he's in charge. But the U.S. has no troops or diplomats Venezuela, and all of Nicolas Maduro's top aides remain in power.
item.content:encoded: President Trump says he's in charge. But the U.S. has no troops or diplomats Venezuela, and all of Nicolas Maduro's top aides remain in power.
item.dc:creator: Greg Myre

item.title: 'Stranger Things' fans hoping for one more episode trade theories online
item.description: Will there be a second series finale for Stranger Things on Jan. 7? Some fans seem to think so, and their theories are going viral with the hashtag, Conformity Gate.
item.content:encoded: Will there be a second series finale for Stranger Things on Jan. 7? Some fans seem to think so, and their theories are going viral with the hashtag, Conformity Gate.
item.dc:creator: Ava Berger
